FAQ

help center

If you're new to winemaking or looking to source new wine grapes for your exisiting procedures, this guide will help you learn more about us.

  • getting started
  • wine grapes

Getting Started with wine grapes

Are you a family-based business?

We are a family run business and love to meet and get to know our members! We endeavour to expand our varieties of grapes each season providing our customers with a selection of Italian grapes.

How much wine is produced by one case of wine grape?

Each case produces 4.5L of wine.

Do you sell equipment for wine making?

Yes,Yes, we sell a range of wine making equipment from beginners to experts

Are wine grapes different to regular grapes?

Wine grapes have thicker skin, which imparts more flavour into the wine. These grapes are also smaller than table grapes, resulting in a more concentrated taste. In addition to being smaller, there are fewer wine grapes on a vine.

What's period is the wine grape imported from Italy?

The grape season starts in August and runs until the end of October.

I am a beginner and what to know more about the process of making wine.

Give us a call and we will be happy to help you further with the question.

wine grapes

What wine grapes do you import?

The main types of wine grape that we have chosen to specialise in are the “Sangiovese”, “Montepulciano”, "Shiraz" & Trebbiano.

What quality is the wine grape?

We handpick trusted suppliers to always offer the best quality grapes possible. We always have the best quality grapes; they are picked at the perfect time and delivered to Italy within 3 days of leaving Puglia Italy.

Are the grapes organic?

Yes, all our grapes are bioorganic.

Where do the grapes originate from?

The wine grapes originate from Puglia in Italy. We handpick trusted suppliers to always offer the best quality grapes possible.

What's period is the wine grape imported from Italy?

The grape season starts in August and runs until the end of October.

prices

How much does each case cost?

This all depends on the grape season and transport cost to our UK warehouse.

How many kilos does each case weigh?

Roughly 8-9 kilos, this is worked out by dividing the whole pallet (104 cases) by the weight of the pallet. For example 900 kilos divided by 104 = 8.65 kilos per case.

Do I need to pay a deposit for my grapes?

No, we never ask for a deposit as we guarantee once the order is placed you will receive your grapes on time with the same quality you know!

delivery

What's the minimum cases for collection?

There is no minimum.

What's the minimum cases for delivery?

Minimum orders will consist of 10 cases.

I want to buy in bulk, what should I do??

Please contact us before the season starts and we will run through the steps.

I'm ordering for my friends, what would I need to do or say to you?

For multi drops delivery please let us know beforehand as we can arrange a drivers who is aware of the situation to allow him plenty of time to deliver your grapes all in one go.

Who delivers the wine grapes?

We have a trusted driver and helper who are also family members. They are always in contact with the office so this means there are no delays in getting your wine grapes.

Where are you based?

We are based in London, but we deliver to the whole of the UK.

Can I bring my own van to collect the grapes from you?

Yes of course, we have a forklift allowing for quick collections.

How much do you charge for delivery?

We charge £1 per case extra for delivery. This goes towards the drivers and helpers wages and of course diesel costs. These are very fair costs in the currently climate.

Where do you deliver grapes to?

Once the drivers arrive, please let him know where you would like the grapes placed and he will do his best to accommodate your needs. Please be aware of covid rules as these will affect the above.

How do you deliver the grapes?

We deliver the grapes on pallets so please let the driver know exactly where you want the grapes to go.
